analyzeResult.content:
--- Original Message -----
From: Sent:
To:
Proudfit, William Sunday, August 08, 1999 1:24 AM Flinn, Colleen
RE: 1999 Legal Conference
Subject:
Colleen,
Thank you for the invitation to the legal conference. I'll send my conference registration to the email address once i have my flights arranged.
I am interested in the breakout session, 'Legal Technology'. We have set up a simple file support system for Tom and Jonathan and their secretaries that uses Excel and Word macros to keep a file list and prints labels. We have also set up electronic file folders on the shared departmental drives that mirror as much as possible their paper filing system. The idea being that electronic 'files' should be filed in the same way as paper "files'. Currently this system tracks about 2,000 file folders for Tom and Jonathan. We are also using this file support system with two groups in the Operations Department in Malaysia and the Philippines. The file support system for the Legal Department has been in place for more than 1 year and it seems to be working. The one in Malaysia has been in place for about 10 months and it seems to be working. I installed and trained the staff in the Philippines a few weeks ago.
We also have a similar type of file support system using MS Access instead of Excel and Word for departments that have more members and files. We use this one in Records Management and plan to install it for Quality Systems Department in Malaysia this fall.
Do you think it would be appropriate to briefly explain how this kind of file support system works at this breakout session? I was thinking I could do a handout and a few slides and if people were interested I could send them the template files by email from Hong Kong. Anyway, if you don't think so, don't worry, I won't be upset!
Thanks,
Bill Proudfit Manager, Records Management PM Asia Ltd. Legal & : HK office 852-2825-1465 : HK office 852-2826-3809
11
2076716501A
-

paragraphs.content:
Message -----
Proudfit, William Sunday, August 08, 1999 1:24 AM Flinn, Colleen
Thank you for the invitation to the legal conference. I'll send my conference registration to the email address once i have my flights arranged.

I am interested in the breakout session, 'Legal Technology'. We have set up a simple file support system for Tom and Jonathan and their secretaries that uses Excel and Word macros to keep a file list and prints labels. We have also set up electronic file folders on the shared departmental drives that mirror as much as possible their paper filing system. The idea being that electronic 'files' should be filed in the same way as paper "files'. Currently this system tracks about 2,000 file folders for Tom and Jonathan. We are also using this file support system with two groups in the Operations Department in Malaysia and the Philippines. The file support system for the Legal Department has been in place for more than 1 year and it seems to be working. The one in Malaysia has been in place for about 10 months and it seems to be working. I installed and trained the staff in the Philippines a few weeks ago.

We also have a similar type of file support system using MS Access instead of Excel and Word for departments that have more members and files. We use this one in Records Management and plan to install it for Quality Systems Department in Malaysia this fall.

Do you think it would be appropriate to briefly explain how this kind of file support system works at this breakout session? I was thinking I could do a handout and a few slides and if people were interested I could send them the template files by email from Hong Kong. Anyway, if you don't think so, don't worry, I won't be upset!
Bill Proudfit Manager, Records Management PM Asia Ltd. Legal & : HK office 852-2825-1465 : HK office 852-2826-3809
